intro: Coreopsis pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its yellow to orange flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity. Coreopsis pringlei is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
